Class Scribbler.joyStickThread

java.lang.Object
  Scribbler.joyStickThread
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
Enclosing class:
Scribbler
protected class Scribbler.joyStickThread
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

An instance of this class creates a joystick window and a thread that uses mouse events to control the Scribbler. The thread will be killed (and the window closed) when the user clicks the window's close icon or the Scribbler's close method is invoked.

Constructor Summary
Scribbler.joyStickThread(Scribbler _robot)
          Create a window and set up a window listener (to handle the window close event), mouse listeners (to handle mouse click and drag events), and a component listener (to handle window resize events).

          Method executed in the joystick thread.

Constructor Detail

Scribbler.joyStickThread

public Scribbler.joyStickThread(Scribbler _robot)
Create a window and set up a window listener (to handle the window close event), mouse listeners (to handle mouse click and drag events), and a component listener (to handle window resize events).

Method Detail

run

public void run()
Method executed in the joystick thread. The listeners do all the work so all we do is sleep all day! If we're interrupted that means the Scribbler's close method has been called, so we force a window close event that will eventually close the window and tell us to stop.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
